Full Job Description
Your Role
As a Gensler Architect, your job is to combine creativity and technical knowledge with business skills and understanding to help guide our clients. You have experience in the design and execution of a variety of project types, and have developed communication and team-building skills which have prepared you to manage projects. In this role, you will have opportunities to develop your existing strengths in design and technical coordination while also beginning to directly manage client relationships.
What You Will Do
Perform technical design assignments that include programming client needs, diagramming and modeling conceptual strategies, developing conceptual designs into technical studies, and construction documentation
Engage directly with clients in the development of contracts, scheduling of the design process, preparation of consultant RFPs, and coordination with client stakeholders to assure approvals
Manage client, team and project coordination, including full documentation coordination with engineering and specialty consultants
Support communication between project team, clients, vendors, contractors, consultants, and building and permitting officials
Provide design support and documentation during completion and execution of design concepts
Work with external consultants, product representatives, furniture dealers, and fabricators

Your Qualifications
Professional degree in Architecture, demonstrated with a rigorous portfolio
Must be a licensed architect
8+ years of relevant architectural experience, with a strong background designing multiple building typologies of varying scale
Proficiency in Revit
Proficient and confident in public-speaking, and in moderating large teams of consultants, contractors, and clients
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Outstanding graphic presentation skills
Ability to develop collaborative relationships across the firm, with clients, and with other key constituents
TO BE CONSIDERED, PLEASE SUBMIT CURRENT PORTFOLIO AND/OR WORK SAMPLES IN PDF FORMAT*
*This is not a remote position. The successful candidate is expected to be in the San Antonio office.*
Life at Gensler
Gensler is committed to
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
. Through our Five Strategies to Fight Racism, we continue to create a just and equitable future for our colleagues and our communities with our clients. We are a solid voice for social change as we impact people’s lives and fight racism. At Gensler, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace environment.
As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From curated art exhibits to internal design competitions to “Well-being Week,” our offices reflect our people’s diverse interests.
We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability, wellness programs, flex spending, paid holidays, and paid time off. We also offer a 401k, profit sharing, employee stock ownership, and twice annual bonus opportunities.
As part of the firm’s commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.



Your Impact:


At Jacobs, we’re transforming intangible ideas into innovative solutions designing the future – today.

We’re seeking a Project Architect to join our team in Central Texas. Someone who can build their experience in the industry and apply it to today’s challenges.

You’ll research, program, plan, design, and detail, building projects for clients, applying knowledge of architectural design, zoning and building codes, building systems and materials for our clients.

Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local. Your role will include participating in large teams and leading smaller teams of architecture staff on projects to produce project documentation, performing and/or assisting in the construction administration phase of projects, maintaining firm-wide documentation procedures and standards, working closely with technical leadership and engineering discipline leads to understand design intent and goals for successful implementation for various facility design projects.

Your most impactful mission in this role is to embrace living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and equality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives. An inclusive culture with many perspectives through diverse backgrounds allows us to leverage knowledge, leadership and connection to bring forth opportunity, creativity and growth.

At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other. Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow, and succeed.

#bia

Here’s What You’ll Need:

Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture from an accredited program
Professional Registered Architect (RA)
Demonstrated professional relevant experience for buildings related design projects
Strong organizational skills to help facilitate multiple tasks at one time, communication (both verbal and written) skills, creative problem-solving abilities, client relationship building skills, and desire to develop leadership abilities
Effectively communicate and collaborate with design team and consultants
Ability to support project manager in forecasting project schedules, hours and budget.
Demonstrated program experience in the usage of Revit, SketchUp, basic rendering and publishing program
Familiarity with building code requirements

Ideally, You'll Also Have:

Master’s in Architecture
Renovation and new construction experience
Experience in large scale semi-conductor facilities, electronics vehicle manufacturing facilities, higher education,
and government work
Experience on fast-track, accelerated project delivery

Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.


At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Project Designer (San Antonio)
San Antonio

MARKET SEGMENT

Various

OVERVIEW

VLK Architects is seeking a Design Architect for our Education and Commercial market sectors due to the high growth and expansion we are experiencing. This position will lead the design process of a project, from preliminary planning through design development. They will work alongside the project team to oversee the implementation of the design throughout the construction document and construction administration phase to ensure the design intent is met. The ideal candidate for this position should be well-versed in all phases of design of K-12 schools, higher education, mixed-use developments, and corporate environments. This position will require creativity and strong organizational skills to find innovative solutions that exceed client expectations.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Coordinates design efforts during all phases of a project including bond planning, master planning, programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, specifications, and construction administration.
Develops presentation strategies.
Communicates design ideas through hand sketching, 3D computer renderings, and verbal presentation skills.
Coordinates with consultants, contractors, fabricators, specification writers, and design team members.
Must work well in a collaborative environment and be able to respond to design needs from multiple project Architects, Directors, and firm Principals.
Serves in a mentoring role for emerging professionals.
Participates in interview presentations, trade show conventions and general marketing efforts.
Ability to manage the design process of several concurrent projects.

REQUIREMENTS

Academic/Professional:

Professional degree in Architecture from a NAAB accredited University
Registered Architect or pursuing licensure

Competencies:

Documented experience leading and mentoring project teams.
Self-motivated, team player with excellent verbal and graphic communication skills
Adept organization skills
Ability to work well under pressure and just work accordingly to meet quick deadlines
Knowledge of current educational trends and how school facilities can respond to them
Knowledge of building codes

Physical Requirements:



While performing this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear
The employee frequently is required to sit or stand for long periods of time; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands or arms
The employee will occasionally climb ladders to review conditions at job site and occasionally lift up to 25 lbs

Experience:

Minimum of 8 years of experience working in an Architecture firm and at least 3 years leading projects
Experience in K-12, Higher Ed, and Commercial market sectors is preferred
Proficiency with Revit preferred
Relevant experience with architectural modeling and graphic software, including but not limited to Enscape, 3DS Max, AutoCAD, Adobe Photoshop & InDesign, Bluebeam, and MS Office

VLK Architects offers competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits such as generous medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, 401(k) plan with employer match, paid vacation and holidays, profit-sharing, and more. Please e-mail your resume to Charles Johnson cjohnson@vlkarchitects.com. No phone calls please. VLK Architects is an equal opportunity employer.

LPA is seeking a passionate Project Architect to join our integrated team of architects, engineers, interior designers, landscape architects and master planners. Our San Antonio studio is continuing to grow, and you’ll have the opportunity to be a central part of our development. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with team members across studios on projects that are both local and across Texas and California. Our clients are both public and private and represent nine different market segments allowing your career to take many different trajectories.
We walk the talk in changing lives by design. Our sustainability commitment is real we are the only large firm in the nation to comply with the 2030 Challenge for the past two years running. Our award-winning projects aim to have a positive and enduring environmental, economic, and social impact.
We’re committed to diversity, wellness, and work-life balance which is neatly summarized in our Just label. We offer competitive salaries and generous benefits, including health and dental insurance, retirement and financial, wellness and other work/life plans.
As a studio we work hard, have fun, and strive for excellence. We are looking for teammates who have the same drive and hustle.
You will be working with directors and principals in the studio and across the firm. We are looking to you to help us continue to develop our talented designers and engineers.
What will you do:
You will lead, craft, and execute the project documentation and contract administration on projects
Lead the technical execution from concept design and documentation process with your team of designers and engineers
Work in unison with the Project Designer and Project Manager and lead the realization of the project
Oversee documentation for schematic design, design development and construction documents
Quality control research for product and construction methods related to projects
Lead the construction administration process
Cultivate and maintain excellent relationships with clients, builders, governing authorities, stakeholders, and team members
Mentor your team members and help to train and upskill them
What we will do:
Provide mentorship from Managing Directors and Design Directors as well as other in-house disciplines on all projects
Provide career growth opportunities including professional development grants and our professional development process
In-house management and leadership training opportunities
Education opportunities including LPA+U and LPA Tech Talks
Provide study grants for exploration including Catapult and LPA Foundation
Project Architect Requirements:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Architecture required
10+ years of experience in all phases of architectural projects
Strong Revit knowledge
Expertise in building codes and construction as it relates to design and construction services
Architectural license required
LPA is an integrated design firm with offices in California and Texas. We specialize in creating innovative, sustainable environments that work better, do more with less and improve people’s lives. We provide a vibrant and rewarding work environment—one that values and fosters creativity, collaboration, critical thinking, community engagement and ongoing career development and growth. LPA is also committed to diversity, wellness, and work-life balance. LPA offers competitive salaries and generous benefits, including health and dental insurance, retirement and financial, wellness and other work/life plans.
NOTICE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES AND RECRUITERS:
Please note that LPA does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed contract, LPA will not agree to pay any recruiter fee. In the situation an agency or recruiter submits a candidate or resume without a previously signed agreement and/or without LPA’s request, LPA explicitly reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of LPA.

Company Description


The City of San Antonio's mission is to deliver quality City services and commit to achieve San Antonio's vision of prosperity for our diverse, vibrant, and historic community.

Our approximately 12,000 employees are critical in the delivery of quality services to the residents of the City of San Antonio. The commitment our employees demonstrate to their jobs and to the advancement of the City's goals is the key to our success in mission accomplishment.

The City of San Antonio has identified four core values - Teamwork, Professionalism, Integrity, and Innovation - to efficiently and effectively inspire, motivate, lead, develop and empower employees in order to serve the public economically, ethically, equitably, and continuously improve and promote the high performance of government.

To ensure commitment to these values and to further integrate them with our organizational mission and vision, it is imperative that we seek these behaviors in the people we hire.



Job Description


Under direction, is responsible for performing professional work managing the development, review, and approval of the design and construction of airport buildings and facilities and providing management of other related City and high profile building projects as directed by the Development Services Plan Review Division. Working conditions are in an office or construction environment with occasional exposure to temperature extremes, traffic construction. Exercises functional supervision over assigned staff.

For more information and to submit your application, visit the City of San Antonio's website at: https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/sanantoniotx/jobs/3754218


Work Location
Development Services, 1901 S. Alamo St., San Antonio, Texas 78207

Work Hours
7:45 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., Monday - Friday

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Oversees the customer service initiatives and the mission of the Capital Improvements Management Services Department.
Directs and participates in project development for one of the project management teams.
Establishes and supervises the setting of preliminary programs, budgets, and schedules to meet project needs and makes recommendations to the City Architect on the project delivery method.
Assists with the consultant selection process and oversees and manages their work products; reporting to the City Architect any issues that will delay project delivery.
Reviews plans, specifications, cost estimates, and inspects sites during construction operations.
Oversees city staff and the consultants as they coordinate with contractors and client departments and communicates with various department representatives.
Develops reports and presentations on projects to city staff and the general public.
Oversees staff adherence to department policies on records and file management procedures.
Programs, designs, draws, and writes technical specifications for City projects.
Performs related duties and fulfills responsibilities as directed as required.


Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university.
Five (5) years of increasingly responsible experience in architecture.
Valid Class 'C' Texas Driver's License.
Licensed to practice as a Registered Architect in the State of Texas.
Must obtain a license to practice in the State of Texas within one (1) year of employment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with oversight of large commercial design projects.

Additional Information

For over 40 years, PBK has been a leader in architectural and engineering design solutions across the United States. We are constantly seeking the brightest and most talented minds to be part of our award winning firm. Here at PBK, we pride ourselves in providing the best in class programmers, planners, architects, engineers, and consultants to offer top notch customer service. We strive to make a positive impact for future generations with our actions today. Here’s your chance, are you ready to make a difference?

Description – Technical Designer

The Technical Designer is responsible for producing high quality construction documents. The Technical Designer can work in all phases of a project, including Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents and Construction Administration. The Technical Designer will report to the Production Director.

Duties will include but are not limited to:

Participate in the drawing architectural construction documents in Revit.
Assemble plans, construction documents, and other information for permitting.
Coordinate the preparation of construction documents with team members.
Assist with the building of Revit models during the design phase.
Assist architects and project managers during the construction administration phase.

Requirements

Must have an Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Architecture or related field.
1-3 years of professional experience preferred.
Strong problem-solving and teamwork skills.
Must demonstrate proficiency in using Revit.
Strong customer service skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Creativity, integrity, and initiative.
Ability to work well under pressure, juggle and prioritize multiple projects and adjust work accordingly, often against tight deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
A strong desire to excel and advance in a fast paced, challenging and client focused environment.

This is an excellent opportunity for professional growth and career advancement within an award winning architectural firm. We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package. An aggressive, client oriented personality with a knack for creative problem solving will succeed in this position.

Firm Background

PBK has built a client base of more than 200 clients, a list that includes school districts, university systems, hospital systems and Fortune 500 corporations. PBK offers employees competitive wages, health care and 401K matching along with numerous opportunities to become involved in extra-curricular activities and organizations established through the firm. PBK has established a culture that has led to the firm being named to the list of “Best Places to Work.”

Alta Architects is currently seeking an experienced PROJECT ARCHITECT with the skills and aspiration to manage delivery of construction documents, while working under the direction of the Principal-in-Charge and Project Manager, on a wide range of project sizes.

WHO WE ARE:

Alta Architects, formerly Munoz & Company, is a multi-faceted and award-winning architectural design firm with more than 95 years of experience. We enjoy a diverse architectural practice that encompasses Large Public and Private work including Governmental, Institutional, Educational, Cultural, Corporate, Mix-use, and Multi-Family Housing. We have changed our name but not our passion for architecture.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

5-10 years’ post grad experience with employment in Architectural firms, 3 years minimum managing architectural project delivery.

PREFERRED EDUCATION & BACKGROUND:

Registration as a licensed Architect in the State of Texas preferred, at minimum a bachelor’s degree in Architecture from an accredited program.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Candidates should have strong graphic and verbal communication skills with a proven portfolio of work in related project types, and aspiration to further the firm’s grounding in culturally based design. Candidates with strong skills in project programming and design desirable. Broad knowledge of technical detailing, materials, and products for heavy commercial projects essential. Should be able demonstrate skills and experience with project management.

Responsibilities will include overall management of the project delivery team including in-house support and outside consultants, overseeing preparation of design studies from concepts through CD’s, organization, and coordination of construction documents, directing and attending client meetings, and follow through management during bidding and construction administration. Ideal candidates will demonstrate a wide variety of abilities, including computer skills in Revit, AutoCAD, Photoshop, InDesign, SketchUp, and MS Office, as well as hand graphics and illustration, with the ability to interact positively with clients, consultants, general contractors, and our studio team are essential.

· A commitment to staff growth and professional development

Description – Designer

PBK is looking for a highly motivated and creative Designer who is ready to join our design team. You will be responsible for producing high quality project design deliverables in construction documents. You will work on any/all phases of development including Pre-Design, Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents and Construction Administration. You will report to the Director/Principal/Associate Principal on tasks and deliverables to ensure the project is completed on time and within budget constraints.

Your Impact:

Create innovative designs that can adapt to a variety of materials and situations meeting client requirements
Participate and lead design charrettes with clients and PBK staff
Generate detailed designs and facilitate the production process
Prepare concept design, schematic design, and design development
Communicate design concepts verbally and visually
Work collaboratively with the Design Leadership in establishing format, drawing assignments, deliverables, and schedules.
Function as a conduit between conceptual design process and architectural implementation
Supervise and mentor teams of Designers assigned to project teams

What You'll Need:

5+ years of related design experience, preferably K-12 or Higher Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture
Advanced proficiency in Photoshop, Sketchup, InDesign, Lumion and AutoCAD
Ability to interact with senior management, external client organizations, and vendors
Strong oral, written, and graphic English communication skills
Excellent time-management and organizational skills
Ability to self-edit work and command a high level of accuracy

How You'll Stand Out:

Design experience with large-scale commercial projects
Proficient in Revit
LEED accredited
Hand sketching skills

LPA is seeking a passionate Project Manager to join our integrated team of architects, engineers, interior designers, landscape architects and master planners. Our San Antonio studio is continuing to grow, and you will be a central part of our development. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with team members across studios on projects that are both local and across Texas and California. Our clients are both public and private and represent nine different market segments allowing your career to take many different trajectories.
We walk the talk in changing lives by design. Our sustainability commitment is real we are the only large firm in the nation to comply with the 2030 Challenge for the past two years running. Our award-winning projects aim to have a positive and enduring environmental, economic, and social impact.
We’re committed to diversity, wellness, and work-life balance which is neatly summarized in our Just label. We offer competitive salaries and generous benefits, including health and dental insurance, retirement and financial, wellness and other work/life plans.
As a studio we work hard, have fun, and strive for excellence. We are looking for teammates who have the same drive and hustle.
You will partner directly with our clients, lead project teams, partake in interviews, attend conferences, and contribute to our growing team.
What you will do:
You will be living and breathing the project from inception to completion
You will be responsible for meeting the project goals including integrated design and planning goals, budget, schedule, and project financial performance.
You will be the main client point of contact on your projects
Prepare schedules, budgets, and work plan documents during all phases of the project
Review contractual and financial construction administration documents
Review research for product and construction methods related to projects
Maintain excellent relationships with the clients, builders, governing authorities, stakeholders, and team members
Serve as the Architect of Record
Signing and stamping, as a licensed professional, all project related documentation which has been prepared under the supervision and direction of the Project Manager or Managing Director
Mentor your team members and help to train and upskill them
What we will do:
Provide mentorship from Managing Directors and Design Directors as well as other in-house disciplines on all projects
Provide career growth opportunities including licensure incentives, professional development grants and our professional development process
In-house management and leadership training opportunities
Education opportunities including LPA+U and LPA Tech Talks
Provide study grants for exploration including Catapult and LPA Foundation
Project Manager Requirements:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Architecture
10+ years of experience in all phases of architectural projects
Architectural license in Texas
Proficiency in Microsoft Project and Excel. Knowledge of Revit and Bluebeam preferred
Knowledge in management of project business: scope, fee, schedule, work plans, and budget
LPA is an integrated design firm with offices in California and Texas. We specialize in creating innovative, sustainable environments that work better, do more with less and improve people’s lives. We provide a vibrant and rewarding work environment—one that values and fosters creativity, collaboration, critical thinking, community engagement and ongoing career development and growth. LPA is also committed to diversity, wellness, and work-life balance. LPA offers competitive salaries and generous benefits, including health and dental insurance, retirement and financial, wellness and other work/life plans.
NOTICE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES AND RECRUITERS:
Please note that LPA does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed contract, LPA will not agree to pay any recruiter fee. In the situation an agency or recruiter submits a candidate or resume without a previously signed agreement and/or without LPA’s request, LPA explicitly reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of LPA.

Project Architect (San Antonio)
San Antonio

MARKET SEGMENT

Various

OVERVIEW

VLK Architects is seeking a Project Architect in our San Antonio location due to the high growth and expansion we are experiencing. This position will manage the design and production process of a project, coordinate consultant documents, lead client meetings, and oversee the project team in the documentation of project deliverables. The ideal candidate has documented experience leading and mentoring project teams, has analytical problem-solving abilities, and is an organized individual.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Coordinate the implementation of design intent into construction documents, specifications, and construction administration. Working with the Project Director to develop and manage the project schedule, will oversee and manage the documentation process to ensure timely and profitable completion of the project.
Provides input and support to the Project Designer during programming, schematic design, and design development phases.
Submit and obtain approval from Authorities Having Jurisdiction.
Attend job site as required to stay current with construction progress and information related to duties during the construction phase of the project. Provide documentation for changes during construction phase and review submittals to ensure design intent is met.
Monitor and direct the design team to delegate project duties and ensure feasibility of produced designs, including the architectural staff assigned and external consultants. Integrate and coordinate all disciplines into the building project. Lead team meetings to discuss project issues, technical issues, and coordination.
Motivate and mentor the project design and development team to ensure timely and effective completion of projects, while also serving as a resource to leadership on practice issues, resource needs, and development.

REQUIREMENTS

Professional degree in Architecture from a NAAB accredited University
Registered Architect
Self-motivated, team player with analytical problem-solving abilities
Excellent communicator with relationship management skills.
Works at a well under pressure and adjusts work accordingly to meet deadlines.
Resolves conflict effectively and encourages a healthy team environment.
Minimum of 8 years of experience working in an Architecture firm, 3 years leading projects.
Experience in K-12, Higher Ed, and Commercial market sectors is preferred
Proficiency with relevant software, including Revit, AutoCAD, Bluebeam, Adobe products, MS Office, and MS Teams.

VLK Architects offers competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits such as generous medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, 401(k) plan with employer match, paid vacation and holidays, profit-sharing, and more. Please e-mail your resume to cjohnson@vlkarchitects.com. No phone calls please. VLK Architects is an equal opportunity employer.
